July 24, 1956
Under separate cover we are sending you samples of some of the materials
we regularly send our members, plus other items which will give you more
information about the Association. Of course, Associate and Affiliate
members do not receive as many of these materials as regularly as Active
members do.
In addition. Active members with radio stations may use the facilities of
the NAEB Radio Network upon payment of an annual assessment fee. The
Network distributes approximately eight hours of programming, by tape re¬
cording, weekly, to members subscribing to its service. This fee is also
based on power (with the same power classifications as membership) and a
new station does not have to pay the full fee until the third year it is
in the Network. The fees are:

Stations must also pay postage both ways on the tapes shipped to and from
Network Headquarters here in Urbana, Illinois, Still even a Glass A sta¬
tion paying its full third-year rate is paying only a little over $2.00
an hour for better than 400 hours of programming from the Network in a
year. This is about the most inexpensive programming a station can do.
Among the materials I am sending are a few that may prove helpful to you
in planninp a station. If, after you*ve looked over all the materials,
you have any questions, please let me know.
Sincerely,
Harold E. Hill
